gurmukhi: surmM isMgrP hrqwl gxM ]cqurQ qh isMbl Kwr BxM ]
transliteration: Suramannd Singraph Hartaal Gadan|| Chaturath Tah Sinbal Khaar Bhanan||
translation: Now I describe the minor metals; they are : antimony, cinnabar, yellow orpiment, bombax,

gurmukhi: miRq sMK mnwisl ABRkXM ]Bn Astm lox rsM lvxM ]10]
transliteration: Mrit Sankh Manaasil Abhrakayan|| Bhan Astam Lon Rasan Lavanan||10||
translation: Potash, conchshell, mica, artemesia and calomel.10.

gurmukhi: Dwq aupDwq jQw skiq so hO khI bnwie ]
transliteration: Dhaat Oupdhaat Jathaa Sakt(i) So Haoun Kahibanaae||
translation: These metals, minor metals have been described by me according to my own understanding.

gurmukhi: Kwnn mih BI hoq hY koeI khUM kmwie ]11]
transliteration: Khaanan Maih Bhihot Hai Koikahoon Kamaae||11||
translation: He, who desires to have them, can get them.11.

gurmukhi: rqn auprqn inkwsy qb hI ]Dwq aupDwq idrb mo sB hI ]
transliteration: Ratan Oupratan Nikaase Tab Hee|| Dhaat Oupdhaat Dirab Mo Sabh Hee||
translation: As the major and minor jewels, the major and minor metals came out;

gurmukhi: iqh qb hI ibsnih ihr lXo ]Avrin bwt Avrnih dXo ]12]
transliteration: Tih Tab Hibisnah(i) Hir Layo|| Avran(i) Baat Avarnah(i) Dayo||12||
translation: They were taken away by Vishnu and distributed the remaining things amongst all.12.

gurmukhi: swrMg sr As ckR gdw lIA ]pwNcwmr lY nwd AiDk kIA ]
transliteration: Saaran Sar As Chakra Gadaa Leea|| Paanchaamar Lai Naad Adhik Keea||
translation: He took away himself the bow and arrows, the sword, the discus, the mace and the (Panchjanay) conch etc.

gurmukhi: sUl ipnwk ibsh kr lInw ]so lY mhwNdyv kau dInw ]13]
transliteration: Sool Pinaak Bisah Kar Leenaa|| So Lai Mahaandev Kau Deenaa||13||
translation: And taking the trident, the cow named Pinak and Poison in his hands, gave them to Shva.13.

gurmukhi: dIXo ieMdR AYrwvqM bwj sUrM ]auTy dIh dwno juDM loh pUrM ]
transliteration: Deeyo Indra Airaavatan Baaj|| Outhe Deeh Daano Judhan Loh Pooran||
translation: The elephants named Airavat was given to Indra and the horse to the sun seeing which the demons, in great fury,Marched to wage war.

gurmukhi: AnI dwnvI dyK au`TI ApwrM ]qbY ibsn jU ic`q kIn ibcwrM ]14]
transliteration: Anidaanavidekh Outthiapaaran|| Tabai Bisan Joo Chitt Keeno Bichaaran||14||
translation: Seeing the advancing army of the demons, Vishnu thought in his mind.14.
